SEARCH
Package io.clonecloudstore.common.quarkus.statemachine

Class StateMachine<E extends Enum<E>>

java.lang.Object
io.clonecloudstore.common.quarkus.statemachine.StateMachine<E>
Type Parameters:
E - the enum class
public class StateMachine<E extends Enum<E>> extends Object
This is the base class for the basic support of Finite State Machine. One need to implement an Enum class to use with it.

  • Constructor Summary

    Constructors
    Constructor
    Description
    StateMachine(E initialState)
    Initialize with an initialState but no StateTransition (Machine State is empty)

    • addTransition

      public final StateTransition<E> addTransition(StateTransition<E> stateTransition)
      Add a new association from one state to a stateTransition of acceptable following states (can replace an existing association)
      Parameters:
      stateTransition - the new association as reachable targets
      Returns:
      the previous association if any

    • removeTransition

      public final StateTransition<E> removeTransition(E state)
      Remove an association from one state to any acceptable following states
      Parameters:
      state - the state to remove any acceptable following states
      Returns:
      the previous association if any

    • getState

      public final E getState()
      Return the current application state.
      Returns:

    • setState

      public final E setState(E desiredState) throws IllegalStateException
      Sets the current application state.
      Parameters:
      desiredState - the desired state
      Returns:
      the requested state, if it was reachable
      Throws:
      IllegalStateException - if the state is not allowed

    • isReachable

      public boolean isReachable(E desiredState)
      Determine if the given state is reachable.
      Parameters:
      desiredState - the desired state
      Returns:
      True if the desiredState is reachable from currentState

    • setDryState

      public final E setDryState(E desiredState)
      Sets the current application state if reachable, and if not reachable keeps the current state;
      Parameters:
      desiredState - the desired state
      Returns:
      the current state, possibly unchanged

    • isTerminal

      public boolean isTerminal()
      Returns:
      True if the current state is terminal

    • getReachableState

      public Set<E> getReachableState()
      Returns:
